description:
The bitter winter of 1941-1942 brings the German advance to a halt. Reeling from their failure to capture Moscow, battered Wehrmacht forces now face a resurgent Red Army, determined to drive the invaders from Soviet soil. In the dense forests and frozen swamps south of Leningrad, a new crisis emerges: at Demyansk, elements of the German II Army Corps and parts of the X Army Corps find themselves cut off and surrounded by Soviet forces in an encirclement.

Trapped deep behind enemy lines, over 90,000 Axis troops must endure relentless attacks, starvation, and the unforgiving cold. Yet, in a desperate gamble, the German High Command orchestrates an audacious resupply effort by air—an innovation that keeps the pocket alive against all odds. The outcome at Demyansk will echo through the rest of the war, shaping German strategy for future battles yet to come.

Can the Wehrmacht restore the supply lines and rescue the encircled forces before it’s too late? With the fate of the German Second Corps hanging in the balance, will they manage to break free, or will the Soviet armies tighten the noose and eliminate the pocket before a relief operation can break through?
